cyclone.name: FAY
cyclone.current_location: about 40 mi ENE of Cape Hatteras, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north to north-northeast along the Mid-Atlantic coast, then inland across New Jersey toward southeastern New York and southern New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to northern New Jersey coast (near Cape May–Long Branch area)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Cape May, New Jersey to Watch Hill, Rhode Island including Long Island and Long Island Sound
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Mid-Atlantic coastline from North Carolina through New Jersey and New York to southern New England
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph gusts) likely Friday evening through early Saturday, with peak winds Friday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–3 ft possible in New York Harbor and back bays; significant surge above 3 ft not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–5 inches with localized higher amounts could cause flash flooding in the port area Friday night–Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, dangerous rip currents, and localized coastal flooding may disrupt vessel movements and terminal operations.
